verses.text: 神我兒，如果你接受我的話，把我的誡命珍藏在心裡，

words.note: Lit. 'heart inside'

verses.text: 留心聽智慧，致力求聰明；

words.note: Lit. 'keep heart'

verses.text: 如果你為求哲理而呼喊，為求聰明而揚聲；

words.note: Often 'understanding' or 'discernment' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 如果你尋找它如同尋找銀子，搜尋它好像搜尋寶藏；
你就明白怎樣敬畏耶和華，並且獲得對 神的認識。
因為耶和華賜人智慧，知識和聰明都出自他的口。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
A key theme in Proverbs.

verses.text: 他為正直人珍藏大智慧，給行為完全的人作盾牌；
為要看顧正直人的路徑，護衛虔誠人的道路。

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

verses.text: 這樣，你就明白公義、公正、正直，以及一切善道。
智慧必進入你的心，知識必使你歡悅。

words.note: Repetition for emphasis.

verses.text: 明辨的能力必護衛你，聰明必看顧你；

words.note: Refers to the ability to distinguish good from evil or truth from falsehood.

verses.text: 要救你脫離邪惡的道路，脫離說話乖謬的人。

words.note: 乖 in this context means perverse/deviant, not 'obedient' or 'clever'.

verses.text: 那些人離棄正道，走上黑暗的道路。

words.note: Refers to the morally upright or correct path.

verses.text: 他們喜歡行惡，喜悅惡人的乖謬。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning to carry out wicked deeds.
Refers to the moral crookedness or distortion of truth.

verses.text: 他們的道路彎曲，他們的行徑偏離正道。

words.note: More formal term for one's actions or course of conduct.
Refers to the morally upright or correct path.

verses.text: 智慧要救你脫離淫婦，脫離說諂媚話的妓女。

words.definition: to escape from, get rid of

words.note: Refers to a woman engaging in illicit sexual behavior.

words.definition: to escape from, get rid of

verses.text: 她離棄年輕時的配偶，忘記了 神的約；

words.note: 年輕時 means 'when young'.
The leading space is a traditional way to show reverence for God.
In biblical context, refers to a solemn agreement with God.

verses.text: 她的家陷入死地，她的路徑下落陰間。

words.note: Refers to the realm of the dead.

verses.text: 凡是進到她那裡去的，都不能轉回，必得不著生路。

words.note: Used as a resultative complement, 'enter to'.
Used as a directional complement, 'go to'.
凡是...去的 means 'all who go'.
Used as a potential complement indicating inability to achieve.

words.definition: a way of escape, path to life

verses.text: 因此，智慧必使你走在良善人的道上，持守義人的路。

words.note: Often refers to God's way or moral path in biblical contexts.
道上 means 'on the path'.

verses.text: 因為正直人必在地上安居，完全人必在世上存留；

words.note: 正直 (zhèngzhí) means upright, honest.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Often used in biblical contexts for secure dwelling.
完全 (wánquán) in a biblical sense implies 'blameless'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Means to continue to exist or be preserved.

verses.text: 但惡人必從地上除滅，行事奸詐的必從世上拔除。

words.note: Often used in contrast to 'righteous people'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Strong term for complete removal or destruction.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to do things'.
Describes dishonest and cunning behavior.
Here, '行事奸詐的' refers to 'those who act treacherously'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Implies complete removal, like pulling out a plant.
